results.title: Change in the Maritimes
results.creator_credit: Joseph Koenig, ONF | NFB and Robin Spry
results.brief_description: This film examines the changing economy of Canada’s Atlantic provinces and the factors that contributed to the expansion of industry in the early to mid-1960s. The film focuses primarily on the choice confronting many inshore fishermen - whether to stay with the free but frugal life that their nets provide, or to move to the city. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Joseph Koenig, ONF | NFB and Robin Spry

results.title: Change in heaven
results.creator_credit: Gwyneth Hughes, Yorkshire Television and Granite Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “China Rising”.
The second two part program in the China Rising series which covers the history of Communist China from the mid 1930s to the 1960s. Part one begins in the north of China in Yunan, where the chinese Communists retreated following defeat by the Nationalists in 1934 in a year long walk later known and promoted as the Long March. The program discusses the rise of Mao Tse-tung from a teacher of philosophy to a political leader as the communists regrouped and experimented with political ideas under continued bombardment from the Japanese and from the Nationalists in the form of economic blockades even in their unification against the Japanese. In 1942 the rectification campaign saw the Nationalist’s fostering links with the United States, links which cooled to favour the Communists after a short time until the surrender of the Japanese and the end of the war. By 1947 the Communists had secured a great deal of power in Northern China until civil war came to Yunan and Mao and the red army took to the hills to await the strength and opportunity to take over from the Nationalists. Part two details this counter attack when the People’s Liberation Army became a conventional force of some half a million soldiers which gradually took over China from the North, taking popular land reform ideals with them and becoming stronger as a result. By 1948 the Nationalists were in full retreat and the Communists declared victory in 1949 after they entered Beijing. The program then discusses the short lived links with Russia and the move away from tradition through new laws and social reforms, including a new marriage law and the instigation of uniformity of costume and education. The second part closes with a discussion of the widening gap between the dream and reality of the Yunan Communist spirit as the grim reality behind the ideas of industrialisation in the “Great Leap Forward” and the crushing of opposition through an anti-rightest campaign became evident in the early 1960s. This comphrehensive documentary uses rare archival footage and interviews with the chinese people of the time and engages with the impact this revolutionary period of Chinese history had on their lives. Includes Teachers notes.

results.title: Change and employment
results.creator_credit: Anvil Films and British Productivity Council
results.brief_description: This film surveys the effects of technological change on employment security. Examines the ways in which management can meet the human problems involved by anticipating the introduction of automation and by training redundant employees in other skills. It contrasts the mass unemployment of the pre-war period with the post-war conditions of full employment.

results.title: Change
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PGR Series”.
Children can be disoriented by change, and here we discuss this process. Parents describe the effects on their children of moving house, changing childcare centres, and emergency admissions into hospital. We discuss behaviour patterns which may indicate change is disturbing to a child. Two families talk about the deaths, one expected, the other sudden, of younger children. Finally we discuss ways of dealing with change.

results.title: Chanel, Chanel
results.creator_credit: RM Arts, Roberta Guerra and Eila Hershon
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Phaidon art collection”.
Narrated by Diana Quick and featuring a collage of fashion images, drawings and archive footage of the late Gabrielle Chanel herself, this is a fascinating documentary about an extraordinary woman and the house of fashion that she created. From her sportswear of the 1920’s through to the creation infamous Chanel suit in the 50’s, this film gives a broad overview of her life and examines the reasons why Chanel has become one of the greatest names in fashion. Also features interviews with Karl Lagerfeld.

results.title: Chance History Art
results.brief_description: Shows six artists at work, one of them being Jimmy Boyle, the prisoner who spends his time in prison sculpting. Three themes interweave through the film - Chance; the role of accident in painting and change in performance - History; connections with surrealism and politics - Art; the present day, the way art merges with everyday life and is mediated by institutions
results.description: Shows six artists at work, one of them being Jimmy Boyle, the prisoner who spends his time in prison sculpting. results.title: Championship basketball highlights: 1975-76
results.brief_description: Includes highlights of the various basketball competitions in the USA during 1975-76. The Junior College Basketball Championship, the NAIA Championship, the NCAA Division II Championship, the AIAW National Championship, the NCAA University Division Championship, the NBA and the ABA Championship are all covered. Interspersed with these is a segment on a basketball camp, in Homesdale, Penn., the talented Tripuca family, and the Converse All America Team.

results.title: Champions of the Australian Turf
results.brief_description: Captures the real stories behind Australian racing’s undisputed idols through the performances and personalities that make them great. Presented as a History of Racing, you’ll see Australia’s first race meeting in 1810, the 1866 Melbourne Cup, the Carbine story, Phar Lap’s greatest victories, Peter Pan and Chatham in the Craven Plate, Ajax winning his third Memsie Stakes, Bernborough’s amazing races, Tulloch winning the AJC Derby and Caulfield Cup, Todman - the fastest two year old, contemporary champion, Kingston Town and Beau Zam, Australia’s first $2 million earner.

results.title: Champions of Sport No.4
results.creator_credit: Grand National Pictures and John Betts
results.brief_description: This film focuses on boxing, sculling and running. The correct techniques for boxing are demonstrated by Len Harvey - middle weight champion of Great Britain. In regards to sculling, Jack Beresford and Les Southwood, British Olympic champions, display the methodology. Finally the runner, Sidney Woodesden is shown, world record holder of the British mile and half-mile.
